DEFECT.DESCRIPTION: The dispatch function 'DispatchAny' does not have any __drv_dispatchType annotations: This can be corrected by adding appropriate __drv_dispatchType annotations to the function. Unnecessary casts can cause this warning.

The dispatch function 'Driver_IoControl' does not have any __drv_dispatchType annotations: This can be corrected by adding appropriate __drv_dispatchType annotations to the function. Unnecessary casts can cause this warning.

The 'MajorFunction' member of _DRIVER_OBJECT should not be accessed by a driver: Access to this member may be permitted for certain classes of drivers. See the documentation for this warning for more information.

The 'MajorFunction' member of _DRIVER_OBJECT should not be accessed by a driver: Access to this member may be permitted for certain classes of drivers. See the documentation for this warning for more information.
The function being assigned or passed should be a DRIVER_DISPATCH function: Add the declaration 'DRIVER_DISPATCH DispatchAny;' before the current first declaration of DispatchAny.

The 'MajorFunction' member of _DRIVER_OBJECT should not be accessed by a driver: Access to this member may be permitted for certain classes of drivers. See the documentation for this warning for more information.
The function being assigned or passed should be a DRIVER_DISPATCH function: Add the declaration 'DRIVER_DISPATCH Driver_IoControl;' before the current first declaration of Driver_IoControl.

The 'MajorFunction' member of _DRIVER_OBJECT should not be accessed by a driver: Access to this member may be permitted for certain classes of drivers. See the documentation for this warning for more information.
The Drivers module has inferred that the current function is a DRIVER_INITIALIZE function: This is informational only. No problem has been detected.
The function being assigned or passed should be a DRIVER_UNLOAD function: Add the declaration 'DRIVER_UNLOAD UnloadRoutine;' before the current first declaration of UnloadRoutine.
